message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Canagliflozin is an SGLT2 inhibitor used to treat type 2 diabetes mellitus. It works in the kidneys to prevent glucose from being reabsorbed into the bloodstream, which leads to increased glucose excretion in urine. Before starting canagliflozin, the patient’s serum creatinine levels should be evaluated because it can increase the risk of developing acute kidney injury. γ-glutamyltransferase and alanine aminotransferase are liver function tests, which are not necessary for evaluating canagliflozin. β-hCG levels are used to detect pregnancy and are not relevant for this patient.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Canagliflozin is an SGLT2 inhibitor used to treat type 2 diabetes mellitus. Before starting this medication, it is important to evaluate the patient’s serum creatinine levels since this medication can cause acute kidney injury. Option A (γ-glutamyltransferase) and option C (alanine aminotransferase) are liver function tests and are not relevant to the medication. Option B (β-hCG levels) is a pregnancy test and is not relevant to the patient’s condition.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Canagliflozin is a medication used to treat diabetes mellitus by lowering blood sugar levels. It should be used with caution in patients with impaired renal function, so serum creatinine level should be evaluated before starting this medication. The other options are not relevant for monitoring the use of canagliflozin.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Canagliflozin is an SGLT2 inhibitor that works in the kidneys to help the body get rid of glucose. It has been associated with an increased risk of kidney problems, so it is important to evaluate serum creatinine levels before starting this medication. The other options are not relevant to evaluating for the use of canagliflozin.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Canagliflozin is a medication used in the treatment of type 2 diabetes mellitus. It works by inhibiting SGLT2, which leads to increased glucose excretion in the urine. One of the significant side effects of this medication is an increased risk of euglycemic DKA, which can occur even in patients with normal blood glucose levels. Therefore, before initiating the medication, it is crucial to evaluate serum creatinine levels, as canagliflozin is contraindicated in patients with renal impairment. The other options are not relevant to the use of canagliflozin.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Canagliflozin is an SGLT2 inhibitor used for type 2 diabetes. Before starting this medication, serum creatinine should be evaluated because SGLT2 inhibitors increase the risk of kidney damage. Options A, B, and C are not relevant to this medication.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Canagliflozin is an SGLT2 inhibitor that increases urinary glucose excretion, which can lead to dehydration and impaired renal function. Therefore, serum creatinine levels should be evaluated before starting this medication. Alanine aminotransferase and γ-glutamyltransferase are liver enzymes, and β-hCG levels are used for pregnancy testing, none of which are relevant to the use of canagliflozin.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Canagliflozin is an SGLT2 inhibitor used to treat diabetes mellitus. It works by promoting the excretion of glucose in the urine, which can increase the risk of dehydration and kidney damage. Therefore, serum creatinine should be evaluated before starting canagliflozin to assess renal function. Gamma-glutamyltransferase and alanine aminotransferase are liver function tests, and beta-hCG levels are used to detect pregnancy, which are not relevant in this case.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Canagliflozin is an SGLT2 inhibitor used to treat type 2 diabetes mellitus. It works by increasing urinary glucose excretion. However, it can also lead to an increase in serum creatinine and a decrease in estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR), so serum creatinine levels should be evaluated before starting this medication. The other options are not relevant for starting canagliflozin.

Before starting this medication, serum creatinine levels should be evaluated because SGLT2 inhibitors can cause renal impairment. The other options are not relevant for evaluating this medication.
